{"step_by_step_thinking": "Withdrawal-induced anxiety in alcoholism is a complex process that involves various neurotransmitters and hormones. Beta-endorphin is an endogenous opioid neuropeptide and peptide hormone that is produced in certain neurons within the central nervous system and peripheral nervous system. It's known to produce analgesia and a feeling of well-being. However, the role of beta-endorphin in withdrawal-induced anxiety in alcoholism is not fully understood and there is no definitive evidence to suggest that it is based on beta-endorphin deficiency.", "answer_choice": "C. maybe"}
